title: Breaking Barriers: First Openly Gay Miss England's Journey
summary: Grace Richardson, a 20-year-old musical theatre student from Leicester, has made history by becoming the first openly gay Miss England. She faced severe bullying during her school years in Leicestershire due to her sexuality and physical appearance, which negatively impacted her mental health. Despite this, Grace persevered and entered the Miss England competition for the second time, winning after performing a song from The Greatest Showman when a planned ballet dance was canceled due to a foot injury. Her victory not only fulfills a personal dream but also marks a significant step for LGBTQ+ representation in traditional beauty pageants. Grace will now advance to represent England in Miss World 2026, potentially becoming the first British winner since 1964. Her experience highlights the importance of resilience and self-belief in overcoming adversity.
